intro: Monsonia heliotropioides var. nivea, commonly known as the white monsonia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pale pink to white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage consists of rounded, velvety leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It is a popular choice for rock gardens due to its compact size and ornamental flowers.
